poem:
Title: "Morning Notes at the Fringe of Democracy"

Like two siblings in the backseat
of a car called America, 
We are divided down the middle,
Contesting imaginary lines on the vinyl.
Our route - an unwritten sonnet,
Each voice seeks but fails to define - 
A homeland sentence, casting shadows 
On our collective horizon,
Hand in hand, we vote for sunset or dawn.
